summary: The domain bitcoin.org is registered, marking the first known online presence of the Bitcoin project.
Satoshi emails Adam Back about Hashcash; Back points him to Wei Dai's b-money, inspiring Bitcoin's design.
Satoshi Nakamoto publishes the Bitcoin white paper, introducing peer-to-peer electronic cash to the world.
The Bitcoin genesis block is mined by Satoshi, embedding a UK bank bailout headline as a timestamp.
Announces Bitcoin v0.1 release on SourceForge, inviting others to run nodes and test the new network.
Bitcoin v0.1 released by Satoshi Nakamoto, the first open-source client launching the Bitcoin network.
Satoshi sends 10 BTC to Hal Finney in the first Bitcoin transaction ever recorded on the blockchain.
Bitcoin v0.1.5 released, a bugfix patch addressing issues found after the initial launch.
Tells mailing list Bitcoin is based on cryptographic proof, not trust, solving the double-spend problem.
Bitcoin v0.1.6 released, an urgent patch to fix a critical bug shortly after v0.1.5.
Emails Martti Malmi ("Sirius"), asking for help writing FAQ text and running a node to support Bitcoin.
NewLibertyStandard posts first BTC/USD rate: $1 = 1,309.03 BTC, establishing initial valuation.
First Bitcoin sale: 5,050 BTC traded for $5.02 via PayPal; earliest OTC valuation signal.
Bitcoin v0.2.0 released, adding Linux support and multi-core mining improvements.
First Windows GUI miner released by Satoshi, easing entry for early home miners.
Bitcoin v0.2.1 released, maintenance patch with bugfixes after 0.2.0.
BitcoinMarket.com launches, becoming the first crypto exchange and enabling BTC price discovery.
Bitcoin v0.2.2 released, further bug fixes and minor improvements.
Laszlo Hanyecz posts interest in buying food with Bitcoin, seeking real-world utility test.
Laszlo makes specific offer on Bitcointalk: 10,000 BTC for two large pizzas delivered.
Community discusses the economics of the trade, debating Bitcoin's real-world value.
Laszlo Hanyecz buys two pizzas for 10,000 BTC, marking the first real-world Bitcoin commercial purchase.
Community celebrates milestone; Jeremy Sturdivant accepts payment, annual Pizza Day tradition begins.
Bitcoin v0.3.0 released, a major update marking wider adoption beyond early testers.
Bitcoin v0.3.1 released, fixing initial bugs from version 0.3.0.
$0.008 → $0.08 — Price surges 10× in ~5–10 days.
Bitcoin v0.3.2 released, introducing checkpoints for added security.
Mt. Gox launches as a Bitcoin exchange, later becoming the world's largest before its collapse.
Bitcoin v0.3.3 released, addressing network stability issues.
Bitcoin v0.3.4 released, with further stability and security improvements.
Bitcoin v0.3.5 released, providing critical bug and security fixes.
On Bitcointalk, Satoshi argues Bitcoin's energy use is less wasteful than the traditional banking system.
Bitcoin v0.3.6 released, continuing stability and bug improvements.
A critical code bug creates 184 billion invalid BTC; patched quickly, showing resilience of the network.
Bitcoin v0.3.7 released, addressing small bugs and network handling.
Bitcoin v0.3.8 released, improving block handling and reliability.
Satoshi implements 1MB block size limit as temporary anti-spam measure.
Bitcoin v0.3.9 released, a Windows-specific bug fix for client stability.
A user offers 10,000 BTC for GPU mining software, sparking the transition from CPU to faster mining tech.
Bitcoin v0.3.10 released, enhancing RPC functions and overall security.
First GPU mining software released, dramatically increasing hash rates and mining efficiency.
Bitcoin v0.3.11 released, followed by Bitcoin v0.3.12 the same day
Bitcoin v0.3.13 released, addressing a micro-transaction related bug.
> $0.06 — Price breaks out after months of stagnation.
The #bitcoin-otc IRC channel launches, enabling early over-the-counter peer-to-peer Bitcoin trading.
The orange Bitcoin logo, created by "Bitboy," is released and soon becomes the enduring symbol of Bitcoin.
~$0.50 — Market cap hits ~$1M for the first time.
Bitcoin v0.3.15 released, introducing small fixes and improvements.
Warns WikiLeaks not to adopt Bitcoin, calling it a "hornet's nest" that could bring destructive attention.
First mobile Bitcoin app enables a phone-to-phone transfer on a Nokia N900, expanding BTC accessibility.
Bitcoin v0.3.16 released, refining performance and bug corrections.
Satoshi withdraws from development, Bitcoin becomes truly decentralized project.
Bitcoin v0.3.17 released, fixing minor issues and improving stability.
Slush Pool mines its first block, pioneering pooled mining for more stable Bitcoin mining rewards.
Bitcoin v0.3.18 released, with further small corrections and updates.
Bitcoin v0.3.19 released, a maintenance update with bug improvements.
Bitcoin v0.3.20 released, the last 0.3 update before the major shift in 2011.
Bitcoin reaches price parity with the U.S. dollar for the first time, a key psychological milestone.
Jed McCaleb sells Mt. Gox to Mark Karpeles for undisclosed amount, changing Bitcoin history forever.
Bitcoin network hash rate spikes to 900 Ghash/s before dropping, reflecting growing miner participation.
Gavin Andresen becomes lead developer, taking over from Satoshi.
Final known message to Mike Hearn: "I've moved on to other things. Bitcoin is in good hands."
Bitcoin v0.3.21 released, continuing enhancements and bug fixes.
First FPGA mining experiments begin, offering better efficiency than GPU mining.
~$10 — Then runs to ~$31.91 before correcting.
Bitcoin v0.3.22 released, improving client stability and usability.
~$10 — Pullback after the first big rally.
Bitcoin v0.3.23 released, refining features and fixing minor bugs.
Mt. Gox hacked; attacker manipulates BTC price to $0.01, leaking database of over 60,000 accounts.
First major Mt. Gox hack sees 25,000 BTC stolen, price manipulated to $0.01 in flash crash event.
~$31 — First major bubble peak before crash.
Bitcoin v0.3.24 released, adding security improvements and fixes.
Jesse Powell founds Kraken after Mt. Gox visit, aiming to build a more secure crypto exchange.
The first decentralized mining pool, P2Pool, mines a block to counter risks of mining centralization.
Bitcoin v0.4.0 released, a significant new version with wallet updates.
The New Yorker speculates Satoshi is Vili Lehdonvirta or Michael Clear; both deny being Bitcoin's creator.
Charlie Lee releases Litecoin's client on GitHub, marking its public debut.
Fast Company suggests Neal King, Vladimir Oksman, and Charles Bry as possible Satoshi based on patents.
Litecoin network goes live, launching as a faster, "digital silver" Bitcoin alternative.
Bitcoin v0.4.1 released, improving transaction and block processing.
Bitcoin v0.4.2 released, a bug fix for network and block relay.
Bitcoin-Qt introduces first GUI wallet, making Bitcoin accessible to non-technical users.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.5.0 released, first Qt-based GUI version of Bitcoin
Bitcoin v0.4.3 released, a minor update for stability.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.5.1 released, stability fixes for new Qt client
First web wallets appear (MyBitcoin, Instawallet) offering convenient online access.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.5.2 released, addressing issues and improving reliability
Bitcoin appears on CBS "The Good Wife," bringing crypto to mainstream TV.
Linode server hack drains 50,000 BTC, exposing vulnerabilities of centralized Bitcoin storage.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.5.3 released, with enhanced fixes and refinements
Bitcoin-Qt v0.6.0 released, new features and wider improvements
BIP16 (Pay to Script Hash) activates, enabling complex transaction scripts.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.6.1 released, follow-up bug fixes and refinements
Bitcoin-Qt v0.6.2 released, addressing stability and performance
Bitcoin Magazine's first issue ships; Buterin co-founds, shaping early crypto media.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.6.3 released, continued fixes for reliability
Bitcoin Foundation announced to support standards and core development.
Bitcoinica faces lawsuits in San Francisco after hacks and ~$460k in customer losses.
Bitfloor exchange hacked for 24,000 BTC, forcing a temporary shutdown and later permanent closure.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.7.0 released, advancing wallet and client performance
Community anticipates first halving event, discussing economic implications.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.7.1 released, bug fix update for stability
Mining difficulty discussions intensify as halving approaches.
Bitcoin's first Halving cuts block rewards from 50 BTC to 25 BTC, initiating programmed supply scarcity.
Price impact analysis begins, long-term supply scarcity narrative emerges.
Bitcoin-Central gains EU regulatory approval as a payment services provider, a first for exchanges.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.7.2 released, final update before major 2013 releases
First ASIC miners (Avalon) ship to customers, revolutionizing mining with specialized hardware.
Mobile wallets emerge (Bitcoin Wallet for Android) enabling smartphone Bitcoin usage.
Bitcoin's 4th birthday: 6.63M BTC mined; supply issuance on schedule.
Coinbase reports $1M in Bitcoin sales, signaling growing mainstream adoption and trust."
Bitcoin-Qt v0.8.0 released, with blockchain database improvements
~$31 — BTC reclaims $31 for first time since 2011, closing a two-year recovery.
Chain split highlights scaling concerns as network approaches capacity limits.
Temporary chain split on 0.8 bug; rapid coordination restores consensus.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.8.1 released, quick fixes to 0.8 release issues
FinCEN classifies crypto exchangers as MSBs under AML/BSA, bringing them under federal regulation.
Bitcoin market cap surpasses $1 billion for the first time as mainstream attention begins to grow.
~$92 — Market cap surpasses $1B for the first time.
Bitcoin price breaks $100 barrier, driven by media attention and growing investor interest.
Instawallet hack forces closure after 35,000 BTC ($4.6M) stolen in a single attack.
~$266 — Price spikes to $266 before crashing to $50 within hours; extreme volatility.
~$266 — Blow-off top; 5–10% daily gains before sharp correction.
Wired reports 45% of Bitcoin exchanges since 2009 had closed or been hacked, showing early risks.
Mining difficulty adjustments accelerate dramatically as ASIC adoption spreads globally.
btcd announced by Conformal (later Company 0), a full Bitcoin node written in Go.
Mt. Gox processes 70% of all Bitcoin transactions worldwide, dominating the cryptocurrency exchange market.
DHS seizes Mt. Gox funds for unlicensed transmission, tightening U.S. scrutiny.
Ted Nelson claims Satoshi is mathematician Shinichi Mochizuki, a theory Mochizuki quickly denies.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.8.2 released, stabilizing new database engine
Bitcoin-Qt v0.8.3 released, enhancing performance and safety
~$89 — BTC trades near $89; mid-cycle consolidation after spring turbulence.
U.S. court rules Bitcoin can be treated as money; case sets precedent for securities fraud jurisdiction.
Senate mentions BTC in laundering hearings, signaling policy attention.
Germany's Finance Ministry recognizes Bitcoin as a "unit of account," taxable but not legal tender.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.8.4 released, security patch against denial-of-service
Kraken launches publicly, initially supporting Bitcoin, Litecoin, and euro trading pairs.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.8.5 released, maintenance and security updates
FBI shuts down Silk Road, seizing 144,000 BTC and disrupting Bitcoin's darknet association.
$150–$200 — BTC stabilizes in $150–$200 range after Silk Road shock; market digestion phase.
Inputs.io suffers two hacks totaling 4,100 BTC ($1.2M), leading to permanent closure.
Hong Kong exchange GBL vanishes with 30M yuan ($5M), leaving ~500 investors without funds.
World's first Bitcoin ATM launches in Vancouver, letting users buy and sell BTC with fiat currency.
~$500 — BTC clears $500 for first time; late-2013 rally accelerates.
Vitalik Buterin publishes the Ethereum whitepaper, outlining Ethereum smart contracts and vision.
$350–$1,242 — ATH ~$1,242 on Mt. Gox at month end.
China's central bank bans banks and payment firms from Bitcoin dealings, triggering a sharp market drop.
Software engineers Billy Markus and Jackson Palmer launch Dogecoin as a lighthearted, meme-inspired cryptocurrency.
Bitcoin-Qt v0.8.6 released, stability fixes for blockchain handling
A Bitcointalk post titled "I AM HODLING" creates the famous HODL meme, later embraced by crypto culture.
Dogecoin's value jumps nearly 300% over 72 hours, trading volume surges into billions of coins daily.
Dogewallet is hacked, resulting in the theft of over 11 million DOGE.
Mining becomes industrial-scale operation with large farms and professional operations.
~$869 — BTC at ~$869; post-2013 high consolidates into early-year range.
Dogecoin community raises over $25,000 worth of DOGE to help fund the Jamaican bobsled team's trip to the Winter Olympics.
BTC China resumes yuan deposits after suspension, following clarification of PBoC restrictions.
Chicago Sun-Times tests Bitcoin paywall; later in April begins accepting BTC for subscriptions.
Mt. Gox halts Bitcoin withdrawals citing technical issues, hiding massive insolvency from users.
Mt. Gox ceases operations and takes website offline, signaling end of world's largest Bitcoin exchange.
BTC drops from $600 to $400 following Mt. Gox collapse, triggering widespread market panic and fear.
Mt. Gox formally files for bankruptcy protection in Japan, revealing loss of 850,000 Bitcoin total.
Flexcoin shuts down permanently after a hack drains its hot wallet the day before.
Newsweek names Dorian Prentice Satoshi Nakamoto as Bitcoin's creator; he vehemently denies the story.
Mt. Gox files for Chapter 15 bankruptcy protection in the U.S. following its collapse in Japan.
Bitcoin Core v0.9.0 released, project renamed to Bitcoin Core
Mt. Gox announces discovery of ~200,000 BTC in an old wallet, reducing the total missing coins.
IRS guidance states Bitcoin is property, not currency, making gains taxable when value is realized.
Wladimir van der Laan becomes Bitcoin Core maintainer, continuing development leadership.
Bitcoin Core v0.9.1 released, bug fixes and improvements
Monero launches with privacy-by-default, using ring signatures and stealth addresses for anonymity.
btcd v0.12.0-beta released, first widely used build.
Bitcoin Core v0.9.2 released, adding stability and RPC fixes
BitPay sponsors the St. Petersburg Bowl, bringing Bitcoin branding to a nationally televised game.
~$592 — BTC ~$592; summer stabilization after Mt. Gox collapse fallout.
EBA issues Opinion urging regulators to keep banks from buying, selling, or holding virtual currencies.
Overstock.com becomes the first major U.S. retailer to accept Bitcoin payments for online purchases.
Ethereum ICO launches, one of the first major token sales funding Ethereum network development.
Bitcoin Dark announced as a Bitcoin fork with hybrid PoW/PoS consensus and privacy features.
First hardware wallet (Trezor) launches, providing offline security for Bitcoin storage.
Bitcoin Dark mainnet launches, creating a new cryptocurrency with anonymity and energy efficiency focus.
Bitcoin Core v0.9.3 released, continued fixes and refinements
Bitcoin XT v0.10A released by Mike Hearn, fork of Bitcoin Core with early block size increase proposals.
Realcoin issues its first tokens on the Bitcoin Omni Layer, marking the start of the USDT stablecoin.
Realcoin officially rebrands to Tether, establishing the brand identity of USDT.
Libbitcoin Explorer (bx) v2.0 released, first major public CLI tool for interacting with Libbitcoin libraries.
Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs) process formalizes development governance.
BTC hits bear market bottom at $152, down 75% from 2013 peak, marking the cycle's lowest point ever.
Lightning Network whitepaper published by Joseph Poon and Thaddeus Dryja.
Bitcoin Core v0.10.0 released, major release with headers-first sync
Blockstream publishes Sidechains whitepaper, sparking design debate on scaling.
Bitcoin Core v0.10.1 released, bug fixes and network upgrades
Paxos receives NYDFS's first trust charter for a virtual currency firm.
Bitcoin Core v0.10.2 released, improving DoS resistance
Block size debate intensifies in community as transaction fees rise.
BIP66 (Strict DER encoding) activates, improving transaction standardization.
Knots v0.11 released, aligning with Bitcoin Core 0.11 but with policy changes (higher relay fee, different mempool rules).
XT proposal to raise block size ignites broad, long-running community debate.
Bitcoin Core v0.11.0 released, new features and major updates
Ethereum genesis block mined, officially launching the Ethereum mainnet for programmable contracts.
Mark Karpeles arrested in Japan on charges of data manipulation and embezzlement of user funds.
Bitcoin XT proposes 8MB blocks, creating first major scaling proposal.
Bitcoin XT v0.11A released, implementing BIP101 for 8 MB blocks, gaining wide attention during blocksize debate.
Bitcoin XT v0.11B released, adding bug fixes and wallet improvements.
First Litecoin halving cuts block reward from 50 LTC to 25 LTC.
Bitcoin Core v0.10.3 released, further bug and security fixes
Bitcoin Core v0.11.1 released, patch for critical issue
Bitcoin XT v0.11C released, a maintenance patch update.
Bitcoin Core v0.11.2 released, follow-up fixes and refinements
btcd v0.12.0-beta updated to include CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY (CLTV) support.
Wired and Gizmodo publish reports identifying Australian Craig Wright as the likely Satoshi Nakamoto.
BIP65 (CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY) activates, enabling time-locked transactions.
Multiple implementations emerge (Core, XT, Classic, Unlimited) creating healthy diversity.
Bitcoin Classic v1.0.0 released, introducing proposal to increase block size limit to 2 MB.
The Lightning Network white paper is published, proposing off-chain scaling for faster BTC transactions.
Lightning Labs founded by Elizabeth Stark to develop Lightning Network infrastructure.
Kraken acquires Coinsetter and Cavirtex, expanding its footprint in U.S. and Canadian markets.
Bitcoin Classic v1.0.1 released, bug fixes and user interface improvements.
Bitcoin XT v0.11D released, adjusting activation logic for larger blocks in response to feedback.
Bitcoin Unlimited v0.10.0 released, first version introducing Emergent Consensus idea.
Bitcoin Classic v1.0.2 released, stability update with bug fixes.
Bitcoin Unlimited v0.11.0 released, bug fixes and stability improvements.
Bitcoin Classic proposes 2MB blocks as compromise solution.
btcd v0.12.1-beta released, adding CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY (CSV) and relative timelocks.
Bitcoin Core v0.12.0 released, new features and enhancements
Knots v0.12 released, introducing Full Replace-by-Fee (RBF) policy.
Bitcoin Classic v1.0.3 released, minor fixes and usability improvements.
Craig Wright claims Satoshi identity; disputed, amplifies identity controversies.
Ethereum Homestead upgrade activates, making the Ethereum blockchain stable and production-ready.
Bitcoin Classic v1.0.4 released, maintenance update for network stability.
Bitcoin Unlimited v0.11.1 released, refining Emergent Consensus mechanism.
Bitcoin Core v0.12.1 released, SegWit preparations and fixes
The DAO launches on Ethereum with a 28-day funding window, pioneering decentralized venture capital.
Craig Wright publicly claims to be Satoshi but fails to provide cryptographic proof to back his claim.
The DAO on Ethereum raises over $100M, becoming the largest crowdfunding in Ethereum's history.
Bitcoin Classic v1.1.0 released, improving mining and network features.
Bitcoin Unlimited v0.11.2 released, stability update with bug fixes.
Segregated Witness (SegWit) proposed as scaling solution without hard fork.
Japan amends Payment Services Act, defining "virtual currency" and regulating exchange operators.
Bitcoin Classic v1.1.1 released, bug fix update for v1.1.0.
Vitalik warns that The DAO on Ethereum is under attack; ETH price drops sharply during the exploit.
Attacker drains 3.6M ETH from The DAO, sparking an Ethereum debate on immutability and governance.
Ledger Nano S democratizes hardware wallets with affordable, secure Bitcoin storage.
Ledger Nano S officially released—becoming the industry's affordable hardware wallet standard.
Bitcoin Unlimited v0.11.3 released, improving block propagation.
BIP68/112/113 (Relative time-locks) activate, enabling payment channels.
Ethereum hard forks to recover DAO funds, splitting Ethereum into ETH and Ethereum Classic (ETC).
Bitcoin Classic v1.1.2 released, performance and security patches.
Bitcoin Unlimited v0.12.0 released, major update focused on network performance.
Bitfinex hack steals 119,756 BTC (~$72M); exchange socializes losses across customers via BFX tokens.
Bitfinex announces a 36% "haircut" on all customer accounts to share the hack losses.
Bitcoin Core v0.13.0 released, major performance improvements
Knots v0.13 released, tracking Core 0.13 (Compact Blocks, improved fee estimation).
Bitcoin Unlimited v0.12.1 released, bug fix for v0.12.0.
Bitcoin Classic v1.2.0 released, major update adding Compact Blocks for faster block propagation.
Bitcoin Classic v1.2.1 released, bug fixes following v1.2.0.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.0.0 released, first stable “1.0” labeled release.
Komodo ICO begins; BTCD holders offered 1:1 swap into KMD.
Ethereum Tangerine Whistle upgrade adjusts gas costs to counter Ethereum network DoS attacks.
Ethereum Spurious Dragon upgrade cleans state bloat and strengthens Ethereum chain security.
Bitcoin Core v0.13.1 released, introducing SegWit soft fork
Zcash launches with zero-knowledge proofs (zk-SNARKs), enabling fully private transactions.
Bitcoin Classic v1.3.0 released, controversial version proposing removal of 2 MB hard limit.
Polkadot whitepaper published by Gavin Wood, outlining a sharded, interoperable network.
Bitcoin Classic v1.3.1 released, maintenance patch with bug fixes.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.0.1 released, maintenance update.
China dominates global Bitcoin mining with cheap electricity and manufacturing advantages.
Lightning Network testnet launches for developer testing and experimentation.
Developer conferences and workshops increase, fostering global collaboration.
Bitcoin Core v0.13.2 released, bug fixes and network stability
Bitcoin Classic v1.3.2 released, final update of the 1.3 branch.
Bcoin v1.0.0 released, production-ready Bitcoin full node in Node.js.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.1.0 released, better configuration and UI improvements.
BIP148 UASF threatens to split network if SegWit not activated.
Bitcoin Core v0.14.0 released, further scaling improvements
Knots v0.14 released, continuing to follow Core while keeping distinct policy rules.
Libbitcoin v3.0.0 released, major rewrite delivering a stable, production-ready build of the core libraries.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.1.1 released, fixing critical crash bug.
BIP148 proposed by Shaolin Fry as a UASF to force SegWit activation.
SEC rejects first Bitcoin ETF proposal, citing lack of oversight and risk of market manipulation.
Bitcoin Core v0.14.1 released, minor fixes and reliability
ENS protocol launches by Nick Johnson and the Ethereum Foundation with the .eth top-level domain.
Litecoin officially activates Segregated Witness (SegWit), enhancing transaction efficiency.
New York Agreement proposes SegWit + 2MB blocks compromise.
btc1 project announced by Jeff Garzik, fork of Bitcoin Core 0.14 to implement SegWit2x.
First BIP148-compliant clients released, letting users run UASF-enforcing nodes.
Bitcoin Classic v1.4.0 released, adding support for the SegWit soft fork.
Bitcoin Core v0.14.2 released, improved peer-to-peer handling
CryptoPunks launch as first major NFT collection with 10,000 unique pixelated character avatars.
Binance launches the Binance Coin ICO to raise funds for its new cryptocurrency exchange platform.
btc1 v1.14.1 released, activating SegWit via BIP91 signalling.
Bitcoin Gold project announced by Jack Liao and team, promising ASIC-resistant mining.
Binance Coin ICO ends, selling out and raising funds that establish Binance's future growth.
Binance Coin launches as an ERC-20 token on Ethereum, used for fee discounts on Binance Exchange.
Binance Exchange officially goes live, driving early adoption and utility for Binance Coin.
Binance exchange launches after its ICO, quickly gaining volume and becoming a top platform.
btc1 v1.14.2 released, refining SegWit2x code and miner signalling logic.
BIP91 locks in, miners begin signalling SegWit before the BIP148 deadline.
Bitcoin Classic v1.4.1 released, bug fix update.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.2.0 released, preparing for the Bitcoin Cash fork.
Bitcoin ABC v0.14.0 released, reference client for the upcoming BCH hard fork.
Sam Williams and William Jones found Arweave to build a permanent decentralized storage network.
Bitcoin Cash hard fork launches after block size debates, splitting the network into BTC and BCH.
SegWit activates, scaling debate partially resolves with capacity increase.
Bitcoin Classic v1.4.2 released, hotfix to follow the Bitcoin Cash (BCH) fork.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.2.1 released, hotfix to follow the BCH fork.
btcd v0.13.0 released, introducing Segregated Witness (SegWit) support.
Bcoin updated to support SegWit and the BCH fork.
Bitcoin Cash hard fork occurs at block 478558, launching BCH with 8 MB blocks and a new emergency DAA.
Bitcoin Cash hard fork at block 478558 creates BCH, led by Bitcoin ABC client.
BIP148 activates; nodes reject non-SegWit blocks, adding pressure to miners.
SegWit2x group finalizes its signalling, aligning with UASF goals and preventing a chain split.
btc1 v1.14.3 released, bug fixes and further SegWit2x preparations.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.2.2 released, minor fixes for BCH client.
SegWit activates at block 481,824, improving scalability and fixing transaction malleability issues.
BIP141 (Segregated Witness) activates, fixing malleability and scaling capacity.
SegWit officially activates on Bitcoin mainnet at block 481,824.
Bitcoin XT v0.11E released, transitioning the client to support Bitcoin Cash (BCH).
~$5,000 — First move above $5k.
Community criticism over pre-mine allegations begins, questioning team transparency.
Team 007 announces Bitcoin Diamond development, maintaining anonymity.
Bitcoin XT v0.11F released, minor BCH client update.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.2.3 released, maintenance update.
China bans ICOs as illegal fundraising, ordering platforms to halt token issuance immediately.
Chainlink whitepaper is published by Nazarov, Ellis, and Ari Juels, defining decentralized oracles.
~$2,900 — China ICO crackdown triggers a sharp drop.
Bitcoin Core v0.15.0 released, performance and wallet upgrades
Knots v0.15 released, adding performance improvements and wallet upgrades.
KuCoin exchange launches, branded "People's Exchange," founded by an initial core team.
Cardano mainnet launches, beginning the Byron era and enabling ADA transactions on the network.
Community skepticism over team anonymity and project legitimacy grows.
btc1 v1.14.4 released, final build before planned hard fork.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.2.4 released, bug fix.
~$5,600 — Recovers to a new ATH.
Web3 Foundation runs Polkadot ICO, raising ~$145M in a Dutch auction for DOT development.
Ethereum Byzantium upgrade reduces block rewards, adds zk-SNARK support, and enhances contracts.
~$6,180 — Another fresh ATH.
Bitcoin Gold hard fork at Bitcoin block 491407; snapshot for 1:1 BTG distribution.
Bitcoin Diamond hard fork announced, to occur at block 495,866 with 1:10 distribution ratio.
Bitcoin Atom (BCA) fork announced, planned for Bitcoin block height 505,888.
~$7,300 — Breaks above $7.3k.
SegWit2x hard fork cancelled, ending the scaling debate era.
SegWit2x hard fork cancelled due to lack of consensus; btc1 development abandoned.
Bitcoin Classic project officially shut down, citing BCH success as fulfillment of its goal.
Bitcoin Core v0.15.1 released, stability and bug improvements
~$5,519–$6,295 — Brief crash during BCH turmoil.
Bitcoin Gold mainnet launches (block 491408) with Equihash-BTG mining algorithm.
BCH protocol upgrade replaces unstable EDA with a new Difficulty Adjustment Algorithm (DAA).
Bitcoin ABC implements new Difficulty Adjustment Algorithm to stabilize block times.
~$7,600–$8,100 — Rally resumes, around ~$7.9k.
Bitcoin XT v0.11G released, supporting the November 2017 Bitcoin Cash protocol upgrade.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.2.5 released, supporting November 2017 BCH upgrade.
Hard fork executed at block 495,866; BCD supply 210M, X13 PoW algorithm introduced.
~$9,000 — Breaks $9k milestone.
Bitcoin Diamond mainnet launches, BCD begins trading on major exchanges.
Elon Musk tweets denial, saying rumors linking him to being Satoshi Nakamoto are "not true."
~$10,000 — First time above $10k.
CryptoKitties launches as first viral blockchain game, introducing collectible NFT gameplay.
~$11,000 — Surges past $11k.
CryptoKitties congests Ethereum network, exposing blockchain scalability limitations for gaming.
~$17,000 — Leaps through $17k.
~$17,900 — Stabilizes near ~$17.9k.
BTC reaches all-time high of $19,783 on Coinbase, marking peak of 2017 bull run before crash.
First stablecoin, Single-Collateral DAI (Sai), launches on Ethereum, backed by ETH only.
Single-Collateral DAI (Sai) launches on Ethereum, backed exclusively by ETH.
Single-Collateral DAI (Sai) launches on Ethereum, backed exclusively by ETH.
~$13,800 — Loses ~⅓ in 24h, falls below $14k.
Multi-signature wallets become standard for institutional and high-value storage.
Bitcoin Private announced by the Zclassic team, planned as a merge-fork of Bitcoin and Zclassic UTXOs.
16.8M BTC mined, representing 80% of the total capped supply and underscoring Bitcoin's scarcity.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.3.0 released, new features for BCH network.
Hard fork executed at block 505,888; Bitcoin holders received BCA 1:1.
Bitcoin Atom mainnet launched, introducing PoW+PoS hybrid consensus and atomic swap framework.
~$6,200 — Down ~50% in 16 days.
Bitcoin Core v0.16.0 released, native SegWit wallet support added
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.3.1 released, minor fix update.
Knots v0.16 released, adding full native SegWit wallet support.
Snapshot taken at Bitcoin block 511,346 and Zclassic block 272,991 to record balances for airdrop.
Bcoin v1.0.2 released, improving wallet and network performance.
Bitcoin Private mainnet launches; supply equals combined BTC + ZCL UTXOs.
Lightning Network mainnet beta launches with cautionary warnings about fund risks.
The DAOstack ICO launches and sells out in just 66 seconds, raising part of a ~$30M total.
Block size limit raised from 8 MB to 32 MB; re-enabled several early disabled opcodes.
ABC upgrade increases block size to 32 MB and re-enables disabled opcodes.
Circle announces USDC stablecoin via the Centre Consortium with Coinbase.
"Team Rocket" publishes Avalanche whitepaper on IPFS, introducing the novel consensus.
Bitcoin XT v0.11H released, supporting the May 2018 BCH upgrade.
Bitcoin Unlimited v1.4.0 released, supporting May 2018 BCH upgrade.
Bitcoin Gold suffers 51% attack, ~$18M double-spent from exchanges.

Snapshot announces a cross-chain voting partnership with Herodotus to enable multi-chain DAO governance.
Trump announces that the U.S. crypto reserve will include BTC, ETH, XRP, SOL, and ADA.
Trump signs an executive order establishing a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve and Digital Asset Stockpile.
Trump signs EO creating Strategic Bitcoin Reserve and Digital Asset Stockpile at the White House.
OKX buys a MiFID II-licensed firm to begin offering EU-regulated derivatives to institutions.
Arweave launches PI (Permaweb Index) token to simplify indexing and building on Web3.
Kraken announces $1.5B acquisition of NinjaTrader, entering futures and traditional finance.
X2Y2 announces the platform will close on April 30 after 3 years of declining usage.
Binance begins delisting non-MiCA stablecoins, including TUSD, from spot trading for EEA users.
Smart contract bug leads to $3M exploit, underscoring persistent security risks in DeFi.
Magic Eden acquires Slingshot, expanding into cross-chain trading beyond NFTs.
Bitcoin Core v29.0 released, boosting performance with faster block relay and transaction validation.
Kraken restructures workforce, cutting roles as part of IPO preparation and TradFi expansion.
KuCoin launches regulated digital asset exchange in Thailand under Thai SEC supervision.
The ZORA token launches on Base L2 with a 1B token airdrop, rewarding early users for platform activity.
Founder announces incentive plan to restore sUSD peg, balancing rewards and penalties for stability.
North Star upgrade—FXS is rebranded as FRAX (gas token for Fraxtal) via hard fork.
X2Y2 officially shuts down NFT trading, pivoting the team toward AI-driven crypto innovation.
Curve's official X account is hacked, posting a fake CRV airdrop to lure users (no funds lost).
Ripple and the SEC announce a settlement, resolving their years-long securities lawsuit.
Coinbase announces $2.9 bn acquisition of Deribit, boosting its presence in crypto-derivatives.
Curve's front-end DNS is hijacked in a second attack, safely resolved without smart contract breach.
Uniswap becomes the first DEX to surpass $3 trillion in cumulative all-time trading volume.
Nansen details the Compound V3 enhancements focused on simplified DeFi lending and risk isolation.
Libbitcoin v4.0.0 released, stable series after years of dev; adds significant consensus logic improvements and modular design.
*Alpenglow consensus introduced*, a full rewrite of Solana's protocol replacing PoH and Tower BFT with **Rotor** and **Votor**, enabling ~150 ms finality and "20+20" fault resilience
Coinbase discloses a breach from Dec 2024 affecting ~69,461 users; no funds were lost.
The Finality Upgrade (F3) cuts block finality time from hours to under two minutes.
ConsenSys acquires **Web3Auth**, aiming to simplify MetaMask onboarding with social logins.
Support for the wethDYDX bridge officially ends on dYdX Chain; ethDYDX can no longer be converted.
Argent rebrands to "Ready", rolling out a renewed global vision and dual app strategy.
Lido V3 Testnet-2 launches with modular stVaults on Hoodi testnet.
OKX launches its fully regulated crypto exchange in Spain via new MiCA-based passporting.
Lido V3 hits Holesky Ethereum testnet; mainnet slated for October rollout.
Tether announces it will end new USDT issuance on EOS, Algorand, Omni, Kusama, and BCH SLP.
Announces lunar lander data storage project, showcasing ultra-long-term preservation goals.
"Dual Governance" activated: stETH holders gain veto rights over risky DAO proposals.
Compound III upgrade officially launches, further streamlining the protocol architecture.
The U.S. passes the GENIUS Act, introducing stablecoin regulations that directly impact Tether.
Trump signs a stablecoin law, calling it a "giant step" toward cementing American dominance.
Network v26 upgrade optimizes gas costs, reducing fees for Filecoin storage providers.
Kraken seeks $500M in new funding at a $15B valuation to drive global growth and innovation.
Security patch applied to critical withdrawal logic via DAO, no user funds impacted.
Bybit unveils redesigned mobile app with a new "Lite" onboarding and upgraded "Pro" trading mode. *(pending public source confirmation)*
Trump signs executive order allowing crypto and other alternative assets in 401(k) retirement plans.
Paxos settles with NYDFS: $26.5M fine + $22M compliance investment over BUSD.
The Uniswap Foundation proposes registering as a DUNA (Decentralized Unincorporated Nonprofit Association) in Wyoming for legal structure.
Coinbase completes the acquisition of Deribit, integrating the derivatives platform globally.
Gemini announces a self-custody wallet with ENS subdomain integration.
Gemini obtains a MiCA license from Malta, allowing EU-wide crypto operations via regulatory passporting.
MetaMask unveils its native stablecoin, **MetaMask USD (mUSD)**, built with Bridge and M0.
Proposal introduced to deploy Uniswap V3 on Ronin blockchain, expanding protocol reach to new ecosystems.
Bybit launches its flagship trading competition, the "World Series of Trading" (WSOT). *(pending citation)*
Tether announces USDT integration with Bitcoin via RGB protocol, enabling native BTC transfers.
Effective date for Tether ending new USDT issuance on EOS, Algorand, Omni, Kusama, and BCH SLP.
Libbitcoin remains actively maintained by Eric Voskuil and contributors, continuing as a key alternative codebase for Bitcoin developers.
Tether discontinues direct issuance and redemption on legacy chains, though transfers remain live.
Reports emerge that the SEC is considering decisions on spot XRP ETFs as part of a new crypto strategy.
Aave community votes for a new protocol aimed at more decentralization and user-friendly design.
Bybit Card rolls out in Europe, enabling users to spend crypto across the EEA. *(pending citation)*
Debuts AI-powered mobile app offering integrated trading and "OpenSea Intelligence."
Nasdaq becomes a strategic investor in Gemini, investing $50M ahead of its Nasdaq IPO and forging a partnership.
Egorov and team unveil a new protocol aimed at decentralization and improved user experience.
All MKR spot trading pairs are scheduled to be delisted, aligning with the rebrand to Sky Protocol.
SKY token trading pairs go live, marking the full transition to Sky Protocol.
